result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terry L. Ogrady

defendant.name: Ogrady, Terry L.
defendant.address: W6685 Log Cabin Ln, Phillips, WI 54555

records.addlTxt: Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts. Bond to continue.

8:44 AM Court calls cases: 20CM87, 20CM102, 20CF85, 20CF97, 20CF102, 20CF126,22CF119. DA Kelz states appearances. Defendant Terry L Ogrady in court.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Terry L Ogrady.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. DA Kelz states case 20CF119 is set for a preliminary hearing while the rest of the cases are set for status. In case 20CF119 DA Kelz calls witness: Shawn Peterson a Deputy Sheriff with the Price County Sheriff's Office. Witness sworn. Direct questioning of the witness by DA Kelz. Witness identifies the defendant on record. Cross examination by Attorney Gill. Witness excused. Court finds probable cause exists that a crime was committed and binds DE over for trial. Information filed, acknowledged by parties and reading waived. Proceed to arraignment. In all remaining cases Attorney Gill gives a status update.DA Kelz states all Victim Rights Legislations have been complied with. Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled. all bonds in all cases are set and are to continue. Defendant gives Attorney Gill contact information on record.
Preliminary hearing on October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:13 AM Defendant Terry L. Ogrady in court.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Terry L. Ogrady.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint acknowledged, reading waived. Preliminary hearing requested, time limits NOT waived. Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled. Bond already set and is to continue. Attorney Gill states she has filed a motion to withdraw as the defendant has requested a new Attorney through SPD. Court states that Motion has been DENIED due to no basis. Attorney Gill states SPD has agreed to give the defendant new counsel therefore she filed to withdraw. court makes comments in regards to the appointment of Attorney. Attorney Gill makes comments. Defendant makes comments. Preliminary hearing will be scheduled within 20 days of 10/11/22.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: 10:25 AM Defendant Terry L. Ogrady appeared by video.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill not in court.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Court questions clerk on appearance of Attorney Gill. Clerk advises Attorney Gill has not entered the waiting room for zoom. Defendant makes statements in regards to his contact with SPD. DA Kelz gives 10/11/22 at 10:00 AM as an Adjourned initial appearance date.

***** No Contact Provision Removed 09/14/22 *****

Defendant may not have contact with the individual(s): J.O. 
No Contact includes: Going to or remaining in any place the individual resides, is employed at, attends school at, or any public location the individual is temporarily located. Contact through means of telephone. Electronic devices, Social media, email, regular mail, or a 3rd party individual is prohibited. The only exception to this order is contact through your attorney or law enforcement in appropriate circumstances.
Order for Removal of No Contact
Signed Request to Remove No Contact
Order to remove "No Contact" from Defendant's bond

10:38 AM Defendant Terry L. Ogrady appeared by video.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he has not received a copy of the Criminal Complaint. Court gives the defendant a choice to have the charges read aloud on record or to adjourn the initial appearance. Court questions defendant in regards to obtaining counsel and communication with SPD. Defendant gives responses. DA Kelz gives 09/20/2022 at 10:00 AM for an adjourned IA date. Defendant requests a bond modification. Court questions defendant on proceeding with a bond modification hearing. DA Kelz reviews the hand written request by the defendant. DA Kelz objects to the modification and gives statements in support of that. Court addresses the parties and makes statements. Court DENIES the request. Defendant states he wants a speedy trial. Court makes statements.
Demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA

Defendant may not have contact with the individual(s): J.O. 
No Contact includes: Going to or remaining in any place the individual resides, is employed at, attends school at, or any public location the individual is temporarily located. Contact through means of telephone. Electronic devices, Social media, email, regular mail, or a 3rd party individual is prohibited. The only exception to this order is contact through your attorney or law enforcement in appropriate circumstances.

10:22 AM DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges. Terry L. OGrady appeared via video from the Price County Jail. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for The State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's next court date is 09/13/22  at 10 am.  Jail gives Defendant a notice of right to attorney.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation. ADA Fuhr states defendant has multiple open Felony cases and requests a $1,000 cash bond. Defendant objects to bond amount and makes statements. Court makes statements and orders bond as requested.
